diff_hunk:
@@ -259,61 +324,124 @@ def test_shape(di, dj, dk):
             alpha = random.random()
             beta = random.random()

+            expected = torch.addmm(alpha, t.to_dense(), beta, x.to_dense(), y)

+            expected = torch.addmm(t.to_dense(), x.to_dense(), y)

body: `torch.dsmm` means "dense sparse matrix multiply" but it expects (sparse, dense) ... wouldn't the opposite arg order make more sense? (or different name)
body_html: torch.dsmm means "dense sparse matrix multiply" but it expects (sparse, dense) ... wouldn't the opposite arg order make more sense? (or different name)
